intro: Heliopsis patula, commonly known as the annual sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and thrives in full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often branched. Heliopsis patula is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
